definitions.text: the front of the human head from the forehead to the chin and ear to ear
examples: he washed his face
I wish I had seen the look on his face when he got the news

definitions.text: the feelings expressed on a person's face
examples: a sad expression
a look of triumph
an angry face

definitions.text: the general outward appearance of something
examples: the face of the city is changing

definitions.text: the striking or working surface of an implement
a part of a person that is used to refer to a person
examples: he looked out at a roomful of faces
when he returned to work he met many new faces

definitions.text: a surface forming part of the outside of an object
examples: he examined all sides of the crystal
dew dripped from the face of the leaf

definitions.text: the part of an animal corresponding to the human face
the side upon which the use of a thing depends (usually the most prominent surface of an object)
examples: he dealt the cards face down

definitions.text: a contorted facial expression
examples: she made a grimace at the prospect

definitions.text: a specific size and style of type within a type family
status in the eyes of others
examples: he lost face

definitions.text: impudent aggressiveness
examples: I couldn't believe her boldness
he had the effrontery to question my honesty

definitions.text: a vertical surface of a building or cliff
deal with (something unpleasant) head on
examples: You must confront your problems
He faced the terrible consequences of his mistakes

definitions.text: oppose, as in hostility or a competition
examples: You must confront your opponent
Jackson faced Smith in the boxing ring
The two enemies finally confronted each other

definitions.text: be oriented in a certain direction, often with respect to another reference point; be opposite to
examples: The house looks north
My backyard look onto the pond
The building faces the park

definitions.text: be opposite
examples: the facing page
the two sofas face each other

definitions.text: turn so as to face; turn the face in a certain direction
examples: Turn and face your partner now

definitions.text: present somebody with something, usually to accuse or criticize
examples: We confronted him with the evidence
He was faced with all the evidence and could no longer deny his actions
An enormous dilemma faces us

definitions.text: turn so as to expose the face
examples: face a playing card

definitions.text: line the edge (of a garment) with a different material
examples: face the lapels of the jacket

definitions.text: cover the front or surface of
examples: The building was faced with beautiful stones
